Send a letter to my liege informing [Root.Liege.GetHerHim] of the heretic!
I better let this particular one off...

column1: # The Mufti improves relations between the liege and a vassal

column2: Vassal Impressed
Due to your recent charity work on behalf of [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName], one of [Root.Liege.GetHerHis] vassals has become impressed with [Root.Liege.GetHerHis] great generosity.

The [From.GetJobTitle] of [From.Host.PrimaryTitle.GetName] has been performing charity in [From.Location.GetName], donating alms and food to those in need. The local peasants have benefitted greatly from the [From.Host.GetTitle]'s generosity.
Perhaps there is still some good in this world.

column2: Your [FromFrom.GetJobTitle], [FromFrom.GetTitledName], reports that [From.GetTitledName] has been humbled by your endless generosity to the poor in [From.Location.GetName]. The peasants are singing your name!
A job well done!

column1: # The Mufti is trampled by a peasant mob (Gets away, Is wounded, Is killed)

column2: [Root.Liege.GetLordSpiritualName] is Trampled by Mob

It seems your selfless charity work in [Root.Location.GetName] has attracted a little too much attention. Before you know it, you are surrounded by a huge crowd of hungry and desperate beggars who claw at your robes, pleading for food.
By the Prophet, let me through!

Before the beggars have a chance to completely envelop you, you cut a swath through the crowd by madly swinging your staff around. You manage to land several solid blows on an old woman with your staff, knocking her few remaining teeth out, and an expertly aimed kick at a malnourished farmer leaves him with a broken nose. The crowd scatters.
Well, I was told to give generously to the people...
When you finally emerge into daylight again after pushing your way through the desperate crowd, you do so covered in bruises and with your robe in tatters.
They could have killed me!

Your [From.GetJobTitle], [From.GetTitledName], was cornered by a desperate crowd of beggars in [From.Location.GetName] and has been seriously wounded while giving alms to the poor in your name. Charity can be dangerous work.
So it would seem.

Your [From.GetJobTitle], [From.GetTitledName], who was performing charity work in your name, made the ultimate sacrifice when [From.GetSheHe] was cornered by a desperate crowd of beggars in [From.Location.GetName] and trampled to death.
Ingrates!

column1: # The Mufti pockets money meant for the poor

column2: [Root.Liege.GetLordSpiritualName] Pockets Charity Money

So much of your master's wealth has been squandered on ungrateful and undeserving beggars, but what of you? Have you not toiled enough to improve the lot of thieves and the depraved? Perhaps it would be best if some of that wealth found its way into your own pockets...
Yes, it would only be right.
No, I must not forget my duties.

Word has reached you that your [From.GetJobTitle], [From.GetTitledName], has given in to weakness and helped [From.GetHerselfHimself] to the alms [From.GetSheHe] was meant to distribute amongst the poor.
Return the gold and all may be forgiven.
Off to the dungeons with [From.GetHerHim]!
